SEARCH

Klasse Stack<T>

java.lang.Object
Stack<T>
public class Stack<T> extends Object
A generic stack implementation using an array. Implements Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) principle. Supports push, pop, peek, and listing all elements.
Version:
2025-02-19
Autor:
Clarissa Czipin

  • Methodendetails

    • push

      public void push(T element) throws StackFullException
      Pushes an element onto the stack.
      Parameter:
      element - Element to be added
      Löst aus:
      StackFullException - if the stack is full

    • pop

      public T pop() throws StackEmptyException
      Removes and returns the top element of the stack.
      Gibt zurück:
      Top element of the stack
      Löst aus:
      StackEmptyException - if the stack is empty

    • peek

      public T peek() throws StackEmptyException
      Returns the top element of the stack without removing it.
      Gibt zurück:
      Top element of the stack
      Löst aus:
      StackEmptyException - if the stack is empty

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the stack is empty.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the stack is empty, false otherwise

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Checks if the stack is full.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the stack is full, false otherwise

    • list

      public String list()
      Returns a string representation of all elements in the stack. Elements are separated by a semicolon (;).
      Gibt zurück:
      String representation of stack contents
